sponge.name: Sponge Method
sponge.desc: Ferment sponge with 30-60% flour + water + yeast, then mix final dough

poolish.name: Poolish Method
poolish.desc: Ferment equal parts flour and water + small yeast for 12-16 hours

biga.name: Biga Method
biga.desc: Ferment stiff dough (50-60% hydration) for 12-24 hours

overnight.name: Overnight Ferment
overnight.desc: Slow ferment at low temp (4-6¬∞C) for 12-24 hours

pan.title: My Pans/Molds
pan.titleDesc: Register your pans to quickly select them when converting recipes.

pan.dimensionsRequired: All required dimensions must be entered to calculate volume
pan.fillRatioDesc: Default ratio for filling the pan with dough (can vary by product)

method.title: Method Settings
method.titleDesc: Customize yeast amounts, fermentation times, and temperatures for each method.
method.yeastConversionDesc: Set conversion ratios for different yeast types based on fresh yeast (1.0).
method.baseTempDesc: Fermentation time adjusts based on this temperature
method.resetConfirm: Reset all method settings to default?
method.formulaAdjustedTime: Adjusted Time = Base Time / Temp Factor √ó Salt Factor
method.formulaNote: Fermentation speed roughly doubles for every 10¬∞C increase.

straight.name: Straight
straight.desc: Basic method mixing all ingredients at once

sponge.name: Sponge
sponge.desc: Pre-ferment with 60% flour, then final mix

autolyse.name: Autolyse
autolyse.desc: Flour+water rest before adding other ingredients

environment.title: Environment Settings
environment.defaultSettingsDesc: Default values applied when no profile is selected.
environment.profilesDesc: Quickly apply profiles for different seasons or situations.
environment.profileNamePlaceholder: e.g., My Home Winter, Baking Studio
environment.altitudeHigh: High altitude: Flour +4%, Sugar -4~8%, Yeast -25%, Oven +8~15¬∞C
environment.altitudeMedium: Medium altitude: Flour +2~4%, Sugar -2~4%, Yeast -20%, Oven +5~8¬∞C
environment.altitudeLow: Low altitude: Flour +1%, Sugar -1~2%, Yeast -8~15%, Oven +3~5¬∞C
environment.humidityLowWarning: Dry: Increased moisture loss, cover during fermentation
environment.humidityHighWarning: Humid: Longer baking time, watch for condensation during cooling

yieldLoss.title: Yield Loss Settings
yieldLoss.titleDesc: Customize process loss rates by category or product.
yieldLoss.resetConfirm: Reset all loss rate settings to default?
yieldLoss.envAdjustmentDesc: Auto-adjust baking loss based on temperature/humidity
yieldLoss.guideNote: Loss rates may vary depending on work environment, skill level, and ingredient conditions. Adjust based on actual experience.

dividing.name: Dividing
dividing.desc: Loss during dividing and dusting flour

shaping.name: Shaping
shaping.desc: Loss during shaping and dusting flour

advanced.titleDesc: Configure calculation precision, units, and expert options.
advanced.resetConfirm: Reset all advanced settings to default values?

expertMode.title: Expert Mode
expertMode.description: Show more advanced options and detailed information
expertMode.enabledInfo: Expert mode displays additional calculation options and detailed information.

mixer.title: Mixer Friction Factor
mixer.titleDesc: Temperature rise during mixing for DDT calculation
mixer.infoDesc: The dough temperature rises due to mixer rotation during mixing. This temperature increase is called 'Friction Factor' and is used in DDT (Desired Dough Temperature) calculations.
mixer.formula: Formula: Water Temp = (DDT √ó 3) - Room Temp - Flour Temp - Friction
mixer.customDesc: Save values for special equipment or personal measurements

tips.title: Setting Tips
tips.mixer: Home mixers typically generate 22~26¬∞C of friction heat
tips.hand: Hand mixing has minimal friction but body heat may transfer
tips.precision: Higher precision requires more careful measurement
tips.expert: More options are available in expert mode

product.title: Product Specific Volume
product.titleDesc: Set specific volume for each product to improve pan size conversion accuracy.

info.title: What is Specific Volume?
info.desc: Specific volume is the volume per gram of product (cm¬≥/g). Higher values mean lighter, fluffier products; lower values mean denser products.
info.warning: Only applies to products baked in molds - Baguettes, ciabatta, bagels, croissants, etc. that are baked without molds don't need specific volume.

custom.desc: Add products not in the default list.

alerts.volumeRequired: Specific volume must be greater than 0.
alerts.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete "{{name}}"?

message.adThanks: Thanks for watching the ad! Creating new recipe.

tip.hydration: Hydration is the ratio of liquid to flour (60-80% recommended)
tip.bakersPercent: Baker's percentage uses flour as 100% base
tip.ddt: DDT calculates optimal water temperature for your dough
tip.altitude: At high altitude, reduce yeast and increase baking temperature

warnings.tooHot: Water temperature is high. This may affect yeast activity.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: If you have questions or suggestions, please reach out
contact.emailDesc: We welcome feature suggestions, bug reports, and general inquiries.
contact.githubDesc: We welcome bug reports, feature requests, and code contributions.
contact.faq1a: Recipes are stored in your browser's local storage. Data won't persist if you clear browser data or use private mode. Back up important recipes using the 'Export' feature.
contact.faq2q: I want to use my recipes on another device
contact.faq2a: Export recipes from your current device, then use 'Import' on the other device. Files are saved in JSON format for easy sharing.
contact.faq3a: Our calculations are based on professional baking formulas but are for reference only. Actual baking may require adjustments based on oven characteristics and ingredient conditions. Always verify results for commercial use.
contact.faq4q: Can I use the app offline?
contact.faq4a: Yes! This is a PWA (Progressive Web App) that works offline after your first visit. On mobile, you can 'Add to Home Screen' to use it like an app.
contact.faq5a: Yes, all features are free to use. Ads may be displayed to support service operations.
contact.feedbackTitle: We'd Love to Hear From You
contact.feedbackDesc: Recipe Book continues to improve based on user feedback. Please contact us anytime with new feature ideas, improvement suggestions, or bug reports.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.section1Content: Recipe Book - Baking Recipe Converter (the "Service") values user privacy and complies with applicable privacy laws. This Privacy Policy describes the types of personal information collected, purposes, and usage methods when using the Service.
privacy.section2Intro: This Service can be used without registration and collects minimal information.
privacy.section2Auto: Automatically Collected: Usage logs, access logs, cookies, IP address, browser type
privacy.section2Local: Locally Stored: Recipe data, app settings (stored only on your device)
privacy.section3Item2: Service improvement and new feature development
privacy.section3Item4: Ad display and personalized advertising (Google AdSense)
privacy.section4Content: Collected information is retained during service use and immediately deleted when you clear browser data or stop using the service. Locally stored data can be deleted by the user.
privacy.section5Intro: This Service uses cookies to improve user experience and provide advertising.
privacy.section5Item1: Essential Cookies: Basic functionality required for service use
privacy.section5Item2: Analytics Cookies: Usage pattern analysis (Google Analytics)
privacy.section5Note: Users can refuse cookie storage through browser settings, but this may limit service functionality.
privacy.section6Intro: This Service displays ads through Google AdSense. Google may use cookies to provide interest-based advertising.
privacy.section7Content: This Service does not provide personal information to third parties, except when required by law or upon request from investigative authorities.
privacy.section8Intro: Users may exercise the following rights at any time:
privacy.section8Item1: Delete locally stored data (browser settings or in-app settings)
privacy.section9Content: This Privacy Policy may be modified due to legal or service changes. Changes will be announced through service notifications.
privacy.section10Content: For privacy-related inquiries, please contact us below.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.article1Content: These Terms govern the rights, obligations, and responsibilities between the Service provider and users when using Recipe Book - Baking Recipe Converter (the "Service").
terms.article2Item1: "Service" refers to the web application providing baking recipe conversion, baker's percentage calculation, DDT calculation, and other features.
terms.article2Item2: "User" refers to anyone who accesses and uses the Service according to these Terms.
terms.article2Item3: "Content" refers to recipes, calculation results, and information provided within the Service.
terms.article3Intro: The Service provides the following features free of charge:
terms.article4Item1: The Service can be used by anyone without registration.
terms.article4Item2: Users must comply with these Terms and applicable laws when using the Service.
terms.article4Item3: Data stored during Service use is kept in the user's browser local storage.
terms.article5Item1: This Service is provided free of charge, and the Service provider makes no guarantees regarding accuracy, completeness, or reliability.
terms.article5Item2: Calculation results provided by the Service should be used for reference only, and users must verify results themselves for actual baking.
terms.article5Item3: The Service provider is not liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from Service use.
terms.article5Item4: Users must independently verify results when using Service calculations for commercial purposes.
terms.article5Item5: This Service cannot replace professional baking advice.
terms.article6Item1: Copyright and intellectual property rights of the Service belong to the Service provider.
terms.article6Item2: Rights to recipe data directly entered by users belong to the users.
terms.article6Item3: Sample recipes provided by the Service may only be used for educational and reference purposes.
terms.article7Intro: Users must not engage in the following actions:
terms.article7Item1: Actions that interfere with normal Service operation
terms.article7Item2: Actions that infringe on others' personal information
terms.article7Item4: Unauthorized modification or distribution of Service source code
terms.article7Item5: Distributing malicious code or attempting hacking
terms.article8Content: The Service may display advertisements to cover operational costs. Users are deemed to have consented to advertisements displayed during Service use. For detailed advertising information, please refer to the Privacy Policy.
terms.article9Item1: The Service provider may change or suspend Service content.
terms.article9Item2: Prior notice will be given within possible scope when suspending Service.
terms.article9Item3: The Service provider is not liable for damages caused by Service changes or suspension.
terms.article10Content: The Service provider may change these Terms as necessary, and changed Terms take effect through Service announcements. Users who do not agree to changed Terms may stop using the Service.
terms.article11Content: Interpretation and dispute resolution of these Terms follow the laws of the Republic of Korea, and the court with jurisdiction over the Service provider's location shall be the exclusive court of jurisdiction for disputes.
terms.appendixContent: These Terms take effect from December 1, 2024.

footer.description: A free recipe conversion tool for professional and home bakers. Easily handle complex calculations like baker's percentage, DDT, and pan size adjustments.
footer.disclaimer: This service is provided free of charge and does not guarantee the accuracy of calculations. Please verify results yourself for commercial use.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.intro: Recipe Book is a free web application that makes it easy to manage and convert baking recipes.
gettingStarted.step1: Manage your recipes in the "My Recipes" tab.
gettingStarted.step2: Enter ingredients and baker's percentage is automatically calculated.
gettingStarted.step3: Saved recipes can be converted to different methods or adjusted for pan sizes.

newRecipe.title: Create New Recipe
newRecipe.step1: Click "New Recipe" button in "My Recipes" tab
newRecipe.step3: Click add ingredient button to enter ingredients
newRecipe.step4: Select ingredient type (flour, liquid, etc.) - important for accurate calculations!

methodConversion.title: Method Conversion
methodConversion.intro: You can convert straight method to other methods:
methodConversion.warning: Liquid ingredients are automatically distributed by ratio during conversion

panScaling.title: Pan Size Scaling
panScaling.desc: Adjust recipes for different pan sizes. Supports various pans including round, square, loaf, and chiffon.

advancedPan.title: Advanced Pan Selector
advancedPan.desc: Uses magic number system to calculate optimal dough amount for pan size. Precise calculations considering pan material and altitude.

ddtCalc.title: DDT Calculator
ddtCalc.desc: Calculates water temperature to achieve desired dough temperature. Considers friction factor by mixer type and calculates ice amount.

envAdjust.title: Environmental Adjustment
envAdjust.desc: Automatic recipe adjustment for temperature, humidity, and altitude. Quick settings with seasonal/regional presets.

magicNumber.title: Magic Number System
magicNumber.formula: Pan Volume √∑ Magic Number = Recommended Dough Amount

multiPan.title: Multi-Pan Distribution
multiPan.desc: Automatic calculation for dividing dough across multiple pans

iceCalc.title: Ice Calculation
iceCalc.desc: Automatic ice amount calculation when required water temperature is low in DDT calculation

bakersPercent.title: What is Baker's Percentage?
bakersPercent.desc: Baker's percentage expresses the ratio of ingredients based on flour weight as 100%.

notes.title: Important Notes
notes.note1: All data is stored in browser (LocalStorage)
notes.note2: Clearing browser data will delete your recipes
notes.note3: Calculation results are for reference only, actual results may vary
notes.note4: Additional adjustments may be needed at high altitudes
notes.note5: Select ingredient types accurately for correct method conversion

feedback.title: Contact & Feedback
feedback.desc: Report bugs or suggest features through GitHub Issues.
